# init(bitmapImageRep:)

**Initializer**

Creates a new graphics context using the specified bitmap image representation object as the context destination.

## Declaration

```swift
init?(bitmapImageRep bitmapRep: NSBitmapImageRep)
```

## Parameters

- **bitmapRep**: The [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSBitmapImageRep] object to use as the destination.

## Return Value

The created [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSGraphicsContext] object, or `nil` if the object could not be created.

## Discussion

This method accepts only single plane [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSBitmapImageRep] instances. It is the equivalent of using [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSGraphicsContext/init(attributes:)] and passing `bitmapRep` as the value for the dictionary’s [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSGraphicsContext/AttributeKey/destination] key.

## Creating a Graphics Context

- **init(attributes:)**: Creates a graphics context using the specified attributes.
- **init(cgContext:flipped:)**: Creates a new graphics context from the specified Core Graphics context and the initial flipped state.
- **init(window:)**: Creates a new graphics context for drawing into a window.
- **init(graphicsPort:flipped:)**: Creates a new graphics context from the specified graphics port.
